00085 class FunctionParameterValueBase {
00086     public:
00087         /* I have to declare the getters and setters for every type of
00088            derived classes that will be instantiated. PITA.
00089            what's worse, i have to define no-ops as default implementation,
00090            because otherwise the templated derived class would remain
00091            abstract. that totally breaks type-safety during compilation.      */
00094         virtual void setValue(const double &) { }       
00095         virtual void setValue(const unsigned &) { }     
00096         virtual void setValue(const int &) { }          
00097         virtual void setValue(const std::string &) { }  
00098 
00099         virtual void setValue(const char *) = 0;
00100 
00101         virtual operator double() = 0;                  
00102         virtual operator unsigned() = 0;                
00103         virtual operator int() = 0;                     
00104         virtual operator std::string() = 0;             
00105 
00106         virtual std::string toString() = 0;             
00107     };
00108 
00110 
00121 template <typename T> class FunctionParameterValue:
00122         public FunctionParameterValueBase {
00123     public:
00124         FunctionParameterValue<T>(const T &_value): value(_value) { }
00125 
00126 //      getValue() is never used. But it seems to make sense to declare it...
00127 //      virtual const T &getValue() const { return value; }
00128         virtual void setValue(const T &_value) {
00129             value = _value;
00130         }
00132         virtual void setValue(const char *);
00133 
00139         virtual operator double() { return 0.; }
00140         virtual operator unsigned() { return 0; }
00141         virtual operator int() { return 0; }
00142         virtual operator std::string() { return ""; }
00143 
00144         virtual std::string toString() {
00145             std::ostringstream o;
00146             o << value << std::ends;
00147             return o.str();
00148         }
00149     private:
00150         T value;
00151 };

00173 class FunctionParameter {
00174     public:
00175         FunctionParameter(const std::string &_name,
00176                           const std::string &_description = ""):
00177             pImpl(new Impl(_name, _description)) {}
00178         ~FunctionParameter() { delete pImpl; }
00179 
00181         operator double() {
00182             return double(*(pImpl->value));
00183         }
00185         operator unsigned() { return (unsigned)(*(pImpl->value));}
00187         operator int() { return (int)(*(pImpl->value));}
00189         operator std::string() { return (std::string)(*(pImpl->value));}
00190 
00192         const std::string &getName() const { return pImpl->name; }
00194         void setName(const std::string &_name) { pImpl->name = _name; }
00196         const std::string &getDescription() const { return pImpl->description; }
00198         void setDescription(const std::string &_description) {
00199             pImpl->description = _description;
00200         }
00201 
00203 
00207         template<typename T> void setValue(FunctionParameterValue<T> *_value) {
00208             pImpl->value.reset(_value);
00209         }
00210 
00212         void setValue(std::string _value) {
00213             if (!pImpl->value.get()) {
00214 #               if 0
00215                 pImpl->value = std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase>(
00216                     new FunctionParameterValueBase(*pImpl->defaultValue));
00217 #               endif
00218             } else {
00219                 pImpl->value->setValue(_value.c_str());
00220             }
00221         }
00222 
00224 
00228         template<typename T> void setDefaultValue(
00229                 FunctionParameterValue<T> *_defaultValue) {
00230             pImpl->defaultValue.reset(_defaultValue);
00231         }
00232 
00233         FunctionParameterValueBase *value() const {
00234             return pImpl->value.get();
00235         }
00236         FunctionParameterValueBase *defaultValue() const {
00237             return pImpl->defaultValue.get();
00238         }
00239 
00240     private:
00241         //  these accessors are never used, but i like to keep them around
00242 //         std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> value() {
00243 //             return pImpl->value;
00244 //         }
00245 //         const std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> value() const {
00246 //             return pImpl->value;
00247 //         }
00248 //         std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> defaultValue() {
00249 //             return pImpl->defaultValue;
00250 //         }
00251 
00253         struct Impl {
00254             Impl(const std::string &_name,
00255                           const std::string &_description = ""):
00256                     name(_name), description(_description), value(0),
00257                     defaultValue(0) {}
00258             ~Impl() { }
00259             std::string name;
00260             std::string description;
00261             std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> value;
00262             std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> defaultValue;
00263         };
00264         Impl *pImpl;
00265 };

00270 class ParameterFac {
00271     public:
00273         template <typename T>
00274                 FunctionParameter *createParameterWithValue(
00275                     const std::string &_name, const T &_value) {
00276             FunctionParameter *tmp = new FunctionParameter(_name);
00277             tmp->setValue(new FunctionParameterValue<T>(_value));
00278 
00279             return tmp;
00280         }
00281 
00283         template <typename T>
00284                 FunctionParameter *createParameterWithDefault(
00285                     const std::string &_name, const T &_default,
00286                     const std::string &_description = "") {
00287             FunctionParameter *tmp = new FunctionParameter(_name, _description);
00288             tmp->setDefaultValue(new FunctionParameterValue<T>(_default));
00289             tmp->setValue(new FunctionParameterValue<T>(_default));
00290 
00291             return tmp;
00292         }
00293 };

00299 typedef Loki::SingletonHolder<ParameterFac> ParameterFactory;
